fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Transport
eu_initiatives:
General interests:  
Internal Market, professional recognition / mobility, provision of services, public procurement, KMU policies, energy efficiency, sustainable construction etc 
 
Current special interests:  
Professional Qualifications Directive and national implementations 
Public Procurement Directives and national implementations 
Services Directive and evaluations 
Sustainable Construction strategy
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: Representing the professional interests of Chartered Engineers, who are members of national Engineers chambers.
relevant_communication:
ECEC Code of Conduct 
ECEC Code of Quality 
 
Memorandum "Let Engineers build Europe"  
 
"9  arguments" why professional regulation for engineers is essential for Europe 
 
ECEC Declaration on Performance Profiles 
 
ECEC Bulletin 2013 - ECEC HIstory and ECEC tools of reference 
 
1st and 2nd and 3rd European Engineers Day in 2011 and 2014 and 2017 - regular event in Brussels/Vienna commonly organised by the main engineering organisations in Europe; professional discussion and exchange between profession and politics on relevant professional/political topics
